thread.title: Second GCC Games: Oman 4x100m relay team claims silver medal
thread.title_full: Second GCC Games: Oman 4x100m relay team claims silver medal

author: muscatdaily@apexmedia.co.om (Muscat Daily News)
title: Second GCC Games: Oman 4x100m relay team claims silver medal
text:
Second GCC Games: Oman 4x100m relay team claims silver medal The Oman relay team celebrates after winning the silver medal Muscat Daily staff writer October 26, 2015 
Oman's 4x100 relay quartet had to settle for a silver at the second GCC Games in Dammam, Saudi Arabia on Saturday. 
The relay quartet comprised 100m silver medallist Barakat al Harthy, Abdullah al Sooli, Mohammed Obaid al Quraini and Khalid al Ghailani. 
They clocked 40.38 seconds to finish behind Saudi Arabia, which won in a time of 40.28s. UAE took the bronze in a time of 43.38 seconds. 
The silver helped Oman's overall medal tally rise to 27 with a day left for the Games to conclude. 
Oman's Ahmed al Owaisi is in the running for the medal in the decathlon event on the final day, along with Khalid al Ghailani, who booked a spot in the 200m final race. 
Ahead of the concluding day's action, Saudi Arabia leads the overall tally with 100 medals that includes 52 gold, 29 silver and 19 bronze. UAE is second with 69 (26 gold, 19 silver, 24 bronze) and Qatar is third with 50 (7 gold, 15 silver, 28 bronze). Bahrain is fourth with 37 (4 gold, 18 silver, 15 bronze), while Oman is fifth with 27 medals (four gold, 12 silver and 11 bronze). 
Fadhil al Mazroui, the administrative manager of the sultanate delegation, said, “We have had a positive outing here. We took part in nine of the 15 events here and reaped success to a good extent. In fact, we have won medals in all the disciplines in which we competed.” 
“The overall medals tally will not reflect our performance as we competed in lesser number of events.” Similar content
